keyMoments.title: White Berets Arrive to Enforce Heaven's Judgment
keyMoments.description: Captain McKinley leads the White Berets to Angel Beach to arrest the Straw Hat Pirates for illegal entry into Skypiea.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Skypiea's police force as the maritime law enforcement equivalent of the Blue Sea's marines.

keyMoments.title: White Berets Use Dial Technology
keyMoments.description: The White Berets attack the Straw Hats using cloud arrows and Dial weapons, showcasing Skypiean combat technology.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Dial-based weaponry in combat against the crew.

keyMoments.title: White Berets Defeated by Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji easily defeat the White Berets, demonstrating the power difference between Blue Sea pirates and Skypiea's police.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that while the White Berets have authority, they lack the combat prowess to handle experienced Blue Sea fighters.

reveals.information: Law enforcement police force of Skypiea, equivalent to Blue Sea marines
Equipped with Dial weapons and cloud-based technology

keyMoments.title: Four Priests Introduced
keyMoments.description: God's four priests - Ohm, Satori, Shura, and Gedatsu - are formally introduced while chasing an illegal treasure hunter through Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the primary enforcers of Enel's will and the main antagonists for the upcoming trials.

keyMoments.title: Enel Demonstrates Divine Power
keyMoments.description: Enel, the leader of God's Army, demonstrates his devastating lightning power by obliterating a treasure hunter from afar.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Enel's overwhelming power and his ability to strike anywhere in Skypiea.

reveals.information: Consists of God Enel and his four priests who guard Upper Yard
Possesses devastating power led by Enel's lightning abilities

keyMoments.title: Shandia Warrior Attacks Priests
keyMoments.description: A masked Shandia warrior (Wyper) appears and fires a bazooka at Enel's priests, revealing the guerrilla resistance fighting to reclaim Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the third faction in the Skypiea conflict, setting up a complex three-way war.

keyMoments.title: Shandia's Claim to Vearth
keyMoments.description: The Shandia warrior expresses resentment toward Enel over 'Vearth', revealing their motivation to reclaim their ancestral homeland.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Shandia's rightful claim to Upper Yard and their 400-year struggle.

reveals.information: Fighting to reclaim Upper Yard (their ancestral homeland) from Enel
Resent Enel's control over the precious vearth that belongs to them
